data.title: This place is out of business
data.text: This place was always empty. No drink specials and the service was not good. It seemed the owners were too worried about people's personal lives than running the business

data.title: RIP Mr. Tequila's
data.text: Learned today April 27, 2015 that my favorite Taco Tuesday place is permanently closing.  Thank you for two+ years of good service and good food.  I am so very sorry that you had to leave us.

data.title: Tries but out of place
data.text:
Went at 8pm Sat night (Valentine's Day).  It was busy but not crazy.   Had to go to bar to get attention & seated; understaffed for being holiday & weekend. Long time to order & we had to ask if we could get something to drink.   Tamela (sp?) was great & spoke english so she kept coming from behind the bar to help & wait on us after initial waitress left & didn't return after taking our order.  There were young kids there & music was good- not too loud so could talk etc.  

The  awkward part was having 2 security guys walking -"SECURITY" very largely printed on their shirts.  1 had fully loaded vest & what looked like a taser gun.  Not sure if they've had trouble there or was preventative but took away from the atmosphere &   very distracting. In most other restaurants you don't see security hanging so close to tables etc.  
Food was decent & reasonably priced.  Asked for small Margarita & waitress brought huge- turns out it was $11.95 . When my husband protested that it was too large, she laughed & said he'll like it.  Didn't tell us it was that expensive & it wasn't that great.

data.title: Big empty restaurant.
data.text:
It was likely the day of the week and time of day that I went, but the place was dead.
A very large restaurant that looks like it was a former dance club - this place could have wicked atmosphere if it was packed with people.

Food was good, portion sizes were big, the frozen lime Margarita did not wow me, but it was huge.

Service was very good (considering we were one of 3 tables being served).

data.title: Mr. Tequila's great atmosphere
data.text: I liked the friendly staff and good variety of draft beers. The servers were attentive. I enjoyed that the building was repurposed from a JC Penney. I will return at my first opportunity to try the food which I hear is outstanding.

data.title: Best Night In A Very Long Time!!!
data.text: We booked the upstairs area of the restaurant for our high school class reunion, meet and greet first night.  The atmosphere was wonderful.  Food and drink extraordinary!  This is a family owned, local, small business.  The pride of ownership showed in all that was happening that night.  If you haven't been to Elgin in a few years - GET THERE!  We took a walking tour earlier in the day.  Everything is sparkling and new.  My friend and I who grew up in Elgin were SO tickled!  We tried to find a piece of trash and couldn't.  The whole historic downtown was was blooming with little pocket parks and historic buildings!  Back to Mr. Tequilas:  if I lived in the area this would be a frequent destination!

data.title: Poor Service
data.text: Stopped in with some friends for a drink, terrible service. They brought chips to the table for us, and then charged us for them! We told them we didnt order them and they said we ate them so we had to pay. Really wasn't about the $4, so I paid it, and will never go back again. Too bad, so much potential. :(

data.title: Order the guac - made fresh at the table
data.text: The food was good - the menu is more of an American-Mexican fusion.  I loved the guacamole made fresh at table side.  Large, open restaurant. I would like to return at night for drinks.

data.title: A Really Good Place For Friends, Groups, and Family!
data.text:
I came with a friend of mine just to take in the downtown environment and check out this place since it just opened up.  It has a very awesome spacious area of seating, and section for people to enjoy some dancing, a nice full bar with TV showing recent news, sports and anything else you would like to watch.  AND THAT'S JUST THE MAIN FLOOR!  This place has second level which also has a full bar and seating as well.   

We were greeted with smiles and was sat immediately.  Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu, the specials for the day, both food and drinks,  and also gave her personal recommendations.  

We had complimentary chips and salsa we ordered some guacamole to go with our chips and another staff member came by with a cart and made it fresh right there in front of us.  I was very impressed, she asked if we wanted to our guacamole made a particular way.  We got to customize the flavor to fit our mood. I loved this! 

We ordered Sopes and also a Tacos Ahogados (a specialty platter).  You get very good portions of food with your order.  Which makes this place a shoe in for those big groups that want a nice place to take in some authentic mexican cuisines.  The food was amazing! 

Tip:  Please be aware that if you do ask for guacamole, the restaurant staff member that makes your fresh batch get tips separately from your waiter.  So please be mindful of that as you enjoy your evening.  She definitely earned my tip!  I wanted to take some extra home. 

There is a huge value here, being in an active downtown area.  This place has great portions of food for the price you pay.  And the drinks specials also equally as great!  Try the Original Margarita or the Mango Margarita.  Both are huge in size and also a great buy! 

I am a Resident Recommended Ambassador for the Elgin Area.

#ResidentRec
